page.title: 01Rural area including Blunts
page.content: A typical example of rural Cornwall with scattered farms producing crops and keeping dairy cattle. The hamlet of Blunts has a few houses, a village hall and although it used to boast two places of worship, only one chapel remains. The River Tiddy runs from the NE to the SE of the area.A web of tiny lanes all over the area make access between the farms and fields easy and also to the main A38 trunk road which is just outside this block to the south. This road is the main 'artery' between Cornwall and Devon with Plymouth only 20 minutes to the east and the county town of Truro approx. One hour to the west. The majority of the inhabitants of the area will be employed in farming although with Plymouth only a few miles away the opportunity to commute to the city is a welcome option.
